1232455731976101889.text: I want to extend my sincerest gratitude to the outstanding judges and their teams who worked in partnership with victim advocates to reach attorneys and let them know how their legal expertise can lift vulnerable women and children out of horrible situations.

1232452877047586818.text: When we launched the POWER Act several years ago, I envisioned an army of lawyers across the country donating their time and talent to defending survivors of violence. I believe we are on the cusp of making that vision a reality.

1232452750576738305.text:
This week, I received some incredible news. In 2019, the federal judiciary held more than 100 POWER Act summits across the country, attended by more than 7,000 Americans – lawyers and victims, alike.
👉 https://t.co/NsmmpVasVb

1232452601632870400.text: The POWER Act mandates that each year, for four years, the Chief Judge of each Judicial District across the country hold at least one event promoting pro bono legal services. We held Alaska’s first event in Anchorage in August of 2019.

1232452429276254209.text: Experts agree that securing a lawyer for victims is the best way to get them out of their situation and to get them shelter, housing and medical care. That work in Alaska grew into my Pro Bono Work to Empower and Represent (POWER) Act, which was signed into law in 2018.

1232452208366538757.text: Sexual abuse & domestic violence are among our most pernicious social problems, and one of my top priorities as a Senator has been to support the needs of victims and survivors. Going back to my time as Alaska’s attorney general, I’ve fought for expanded pro bono legal services.

1030563952290398208.text: 3) To get ideas from members of the community on how to fight crime. (4) Have federal officials hear about how, despite our challenges, there are amazing examples of people all across AK working in their communities to try to keep us all safe. #ConfrontingAKCrimeWave

1030563445215772673.text: So today we organized this summit with four goals in mind: (1)To bring federal, state and local officials together to coordinate efforts. (2) To paint a picture for the federal officials here about the unique challenges that we face here in Alaska in countering drug trafficking.

1030562963839696896.text: The vast majority of this is fueled by the drug epidemic. But here is the good news. We are Alaskans. We are tough, we are resilient and we innovative. There is no doubt in my mind that we can conquer this.

1030562794578567175.text: Its critical to remember that behind these statistics and numbers is a personal story of a fellow Alaskan and their family of heartbreak, tragedy, sorrow and anger. #ConfrontingAKCrimeWave

1030562583022120960.text: In the last 5 years the murder rate in Alaska is up 79%. Rape is up 16%. Assault is up 36%. Robbery is up 52%. Vehicle theft is up 150%. Burglary is up 42%. #ConfrontingAKCrimeWave

1030562092842139648.text: Nearly every day I hear from Alaskans about cars stolen and houses broken into. Shootings on our streets. Just days ago the Alaska Dept. of Safety put out their annual crime report. The numbers are staggering. #ConfrontingAKCrimeWave

1030557870318936064.text: Today we are focused not only on our addiction epidemic, but on drug trafficking and the associated crime wave that is victimizing so many Alaskans.

1030557735392358400.text: We took the ideas from people in the audience and we put them to action. This summit, the Alaska Wellness Summit 2.0: Confronting Alaska’s Crime Wave, is a follow up to that. #ConfrontingAKCrimeWave

999437878764687360.text: And while there is never a perfect solution, this legislation is built around an overwhelming belief that our veterans should be receiving the best care available to them.

999437791737073669.text: As a nation, we owe our veterans and their families a great deal of gratitude and debt. This bill is a small step in the right direction to ensure our VA is responsive to their needs, accountable for their actions and prepared to fulfill this nation’s promises.

999437680407732229.text: While many of these solutions we done administratively, it was imperative to solidify them into law.

999437608500547584.text: This included efforts to pull scheduling back to Alaskans within the VA, allow for the continuation of very successful tribal sharing agreements; and ensuring community providers in Alaska are fairly compensated at rates reflecting the high cost of healthcare in our state.

999437418192392193.text: Throughout this process, I worked to ensure this bill properly recognizes that AK’s VA system has & continues to be unique. Building upon the lessons learned from the failed implementation of the VA Choice Act, we fought hard to protect the progress made in AK in recent years.

999436822739607552.text: Today I proudly voted for the VA MISSION Act, which modernizes the way the VA approaches healthcare. It’s built on the idea – one that we continue to champion in Alaska – that no matter where our veterans live they have the right to prompt, quality care close to home.

968622583867478017.text: And sixth, we want to be a land of the future—where opportunities are unleashed for our families and our children that we can’t begin to fathom today.  #akleg

968622276815065090.text: Fourth, we want to be safe in our homes, villages, neighborhoods, and schools. #akleg

968622143859773440.text: Third, we want to live in healthy communities, with clean air and clean water and a pristine environment that supports thriving populations of fish and game. #akleg

968622012146094086.text: Second, we want a vibrant economy that brings widespread prosperity to all Alaskans. #akleg

968621642032340993.text: First, we need a federal government that is a partner in opportunity, not an obstacle. #akleg

955266602089500672.text:
Today marks the second day of the government shutdown – something that was entirely avoidable. Importantly, I want to share directly with you a few updates from Washington, D.C. – specifically how we got to this point and a possible path forward.

https://t.co/HIdnVKFWYL

954865468837388294.text: Yesterday, the Minority Leader had a choice. Sadly, he decided to turn a manufactured crisis into a government shutdown. https://t.co/2BDeNxYmwm

954615012668198913.text: As work continues, I am hopeful that we can find a solution to reopen the government.  The American people, particularly our veterans & troops, deserve better. My office stands ready to assist Alaskans, including those negatively impacted by this unnecessary government shutdown.

954614715396767745.text: I simply fail to understand the logic behind the Minority Leader’s decision to shut down the govt. Passage of the CR tonight would have continued the essential functions of govt, provided funding for CHIP & given Congress an opportunity to address a long term spending measure.

954613868441096192.text: The bipartisan bill we considered tonight, which funded the government until February 16th, was voted down not for the items it contained, but for what was not included – a long term agreement on immigration for which we still have weeks to resolve.

954613713419501569.text: Tonight, we saw a manufactured crisis officially turn into a government shutdown – something that was absolutely preventable.

954555545985404928.text: The bill before us prevents a government shutdown, funds CHIP for six years and delays a number of harmful Obamacare taxes. While a resolution on immigration reform is important, funding the government must take priority.

954211620774993920.text: While I believe a resolution on immigration reform – one that includes an increase in border security – should occur, keeping the government open and operational must take priority.

954211529431363586.text: The short-term funding measure currently before us, which I support, contains numerous provisions that enjoy nearly universal backing in Alaska and Congress – including a six year extension of CHIP and delays to Obamacare’s Cadillac and Medical Device taxes.

954211385843601414.text: Yet tonight, in the face of a government shutdown, the Senate Minority Leader is now emphasizing an issue he has rarely focused on – rebuilding our military – while failing to mention his primary reason for shutting down the govt – a lack of an agreement on immigration reform.

954211258210881536.text: For months, Congress has worked to debate and negotiate a long term spending measure – one that appropriately supports our men and women in uniform, establishes policies that grow our economy, and tackles a series of leading national priorities.

954210780303544321.text: The only thing worse than another Continuing Resolution – particularly for our military and veterans – is a government shutdown.

805931765944684544.text: The Rebuild America Now Act would prevent billions from being wasted in red tape/litigation, make it easier to overhaul U.S. infrastructure.

805930757839470594.text: My bill will include a builder's & worker's bill of rights, requiring timely permitting decisions, and transparency from federal agencies.

805929754041942017.text: Rebuild America Now Act would limit sue-and-settle practices used by radical groups to abuse the judicial system, delay projects to death.

805928744871305216.text: This simple one-in one-out rule on federal regulations has been successfully implemented in the UK and Canada. #RegulationNation

805928242024681473.text: My bill would also cap regulations, requiring old regs to be eliminated for every new reg enacted by a federal agency (RED Tape Act).

805927486466899970.text: Rebuild America Now Act would (2) create 1-stop shop for environmental reviews, ensuring projects don't get bogged down by endless agencies.

805926731206930432.text: In new Congress, I will introduce the Rebuild America Now Act - (1) establishes time limits for approval/denial of permits for good cause.
